articles.description: Almost a year since their collapse, Arsenal prove at Manchester City they are not going away in the Premier League title race.
articles.title: 'Stern and steely Arsenal not going away in title race'

articles.description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp is full of admiration for Brighton counterpart Roberto de Zerbi, who has been linked to succeeding the German at Anfield.
articles.title: Klopp hails 'incredible' De Zerbi after Anfield love-in

articles.description: Rishabh Pant scores his first half-century since a 14-month injury absence as Delhi Capitals beat Chennai Super Kings in the Indian Premier League.
articles.title: Pant prowess helps Capitals beat Super Kings

articles.description: Real Madrid's final match before facing Manchester City in the Champions League ends in victory over Athletic Bilbao thanks to two fine goals by Rodrygo.
articles.title: Real Madrid win to go eight points clear at top

articles.description: Ten-man Paris St-Germain move 12 points clear at the top of Ligue 1 with a 2-0 win over Marseille.
articles.title: Ten-man PSG beat Marseille to move 12 points clear

articles.description: Arsenal boss Jonas Eidevall says it was "irresponsible" of Chelsea's Emma Hayes to refer to him showing "male aggression".
articles.title: Hayes' 'aggression' comment irresponsible - Eidevall

articles.description: Italy's Jannik Sinner beats Bulgarian Grigor Dimitrov 6-3 6-1 to win the Miami Open men's title.
articles.title: Miami Open: Jannik Sinner beats Grigor Dimitrov in straight sets to win men's title

articles.description: British and Commonwealth heavyweight champion Fabio Wardley and challenger Frazer Clarke contest a thrilling and bruising split-decision draw in London.
articles.title: Fabio Wardley v Frazer Clarke: Bruising British heavyweight title fight ends in split-decision draw

articles.description: Germany's Stephan Jaeger wins his first PGA Tour title at the 135th attempt with victory at the Houston Open.
articles.title: Houston Open: Stephan Jaeger wins first PGA Tour title as Scottie Scheffler misses out

articles.description: Celtic return to top spot in the Premiership as they sink bottom club Livingston with three goals in a strong second-half showing.
articles.title: Celtic back on top after beating Livingston
